key_mistakes.reason: Missed opportunity to control the center more aggressively.
Develops the bishop but misses a chance to exert more pressure on the center.
Weakens the kingside and allows White to gain a better center control.
Captures too early, losing the potential for better development.
Moves a piece to a less effective square, missing a better developing move.
Traded knight for bishop, losing control of the center.
The move fails to develop the knight and leaves the queen exposed.
Allows White to capture crucial material for free.
Allows White to consolidate its position with a strong queen move.
Gives away control of the center and opens up the position unnecessarily.
Misses a winning line with a strong capture.
Fails to protect the king and allows a winning combination for Black.
Misses the opportunity to improve the position and protect important squares.

recommendations: Focus more on controlling the center early in the game.
Develop pieces with a clear plan and purpose.
Pay attention to opponent's threats and ensure king safety.
Look for tactical opportunities and better squares for your pieces.
